title: 110_s2030
content: SECTION 1. REPORTING OF BUNDLED CONTRIBUTIONS BY PERSONS OTHER THAN REGISTERED LOBBYISTS. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to specify reporting requirements for committees related to presidential campaigns. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to specify reporting requirements for committees related to presidential campaigns, including periods for reporting bundled contributions exceeding a certain threshold. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to specify reporting requirements for committees related to presidential campaigns, including thresholds for bundled contributions. The applicable threshold is $50,000 for a committee of a presidential candidate and $15,000 for any other committee. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to specify reporting requirements for committees related to presidential campaigns, including thresholds for bundled contributions. If the contribution exceeds the threshold, it must be excluded, and separate reporting is required for certain persons listed on the schedule. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to specify reporting requirements for committees related to presidential campaigns, including thresholds for bundled contributions. The schedule required shall include the aggregate amount of bundled contributions provided by certain persons during the covered period. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to specify reporting requirements for committees related to presidential campaigns, including thresholds for bundled contributions. The term 'bundled contribution' excludes contributions forwarded by or credited to a regularly paid employee of the committee. The amendments made by this section shall take effect as if included in section 204 of the Honest Leadership and Open Government Act of 2007.
